speaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Picture Editing for a Series
text: Ron Volk  * * *  ## Transcript {kathy churay}     _ACT ONE  Scene One - Cafe Nervosa - Evening. Niles is sitting alone at a table at Cafe Nervosa, sadly stirring a coffee as Roz drags in.  Two of the cafe staff are sweeping and cleaning at the back tables._

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, hey, Niles.
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Picture Editing for a Series

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: [_glumly_] God, do you realize how pathetic this is?  It's 9:30 on a Saturday night and neither one of us is surprised to see the other one here alone.  I've never seen this place looking so grim.

speaker: Niles
text: [_even more depressed_] Oh, this is Mardi Gras compared to half an hour ago, when it was just me and an elderly gentleman who cleaned his teeth with his coffee stirrer, and then put them back in his mouth.  Let me get the waitress. [_catching the waitress's eye_]

speaker: Roz
text: Oh God, not her, I hate her.  She's in my spinning class at the gym.  I've been killing myself trying to take off these last five pregnancy pounds, and nothing!  Meanwhile she's down at the snack bar stuffing her face and waving to everybody. She's such a phony.

speaker: Kit
text: Hi, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Kit, you were great in class tonight!

speaker: Kit
text: Are you kidding?  I've been such an oinker lately.  What can I get you?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, a non-fat latte for me.

speaker: Kit
text: [_leaving_] Coming right up.

speaker: Roz
text: See what I mean?  She's such a fake.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry, Roz, I'm afraid I'm not going to be very good company tonight.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, whatever your problems are, you'll laugh at them when you hear what I've been through.  I had a date tonight.  I got halfway down my driveway when he called me on my car phone and cancelled.  I was too humiliated to go back in the house and face the sitter, so - don't ask me why - I went to the zoo. You really want to feel good about yourself?  Put on your best outfit and walk through the monkey house on a Saturday night. And be sure and stop by and see Remo the baboon, who knows all kinds of ways to have fun without a date.  Feeling better about your problem?

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne and Donny got engaged yesterday.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh my God.

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, and lucky me, I had to sit there and watch, horrified. There wasn't a thing I could to do stop it - much like your monkey house experience.

speaker: Roz
text: I am so sorry, Niles.  You really did have a worse night than I did. _Just then Noel Shempsky enters the cafe and is immediately drawn to Roz._

speaker: Noel
text: Hey, Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: [_miserably to Niles_] Oh wait, I'm gaining on you.

speaker: Noel
text: Isn't this a splendiferous surprise?  So Roz, Dr. Crane - is this a date?

speaker: Niles
text: No, just a chance meeting. [_to Roz's grimace_] Sorry.

speaker: Noel
text: So Roz, where is this person you told me you had a date with?

speaker: Roz
text: That got cancelled.

speaker: Noel
text: [_archly_] Oh... "cancelled," you say?  And here you are, showing up at my regular Saturday night hangout.  Will the coincidences never stop?  Perhaps you'd care to join me for a late supper?

speaker: Roz
text: No, Noel.  As I said earlier, I'm really not in the mood.

speaker: Noel
text: Playing hard to get, I see. [_to Niles, sotto voce_] It's all part of the mating dance.  Watch and learn. **BED AND BREAKFAST**  _Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment - The Next Morning. Frasier in his bathrobe ushers in Niles, nattily dressed in a blazer and slacks and carrying his trench coat.  Martin, also in his robe, is reading the paper in his Chair._

speaker: Niles
text: Morning.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, Niles.  Armani?  At eight in the morning on a Sunday?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, yes, I'm having lunch with Maris.

speaker: Martin
text: With Maris?

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah.  We scheduled this weeks ago.  She still has some of my first editions, and I thought she might be more amenable to returning them if I took her to her favorite bistro.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well then, the worst you're out is a cup of clear broth.

speaker: Niles
text: No, this is lunch.  She takes her large meal in the evening. I'm sorry to barge in so early, but I had to get out of the Montana.  The couple next door were just married and they kept me up all week with their boisterous lovemaking.  Why is it when you're by yourself there's nothing but couples in love rubbing it in your face?  _Faye enters in Frasier's bathrobe and pads over to the table to give him an affectionate kiss._

speaker: Faye
text: Good morning!  Niles, are you going to join us for breakfast?

speaker: Niles
text: [_begging off_] For breakfast?  Well, actually-

speaker: Faye
text: Oh, come on, you've got to.  I brought some pastries from the restaurant.

speaker: Martin
text: I didn't even hear you two come in last night.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we got in kind of late.  We took a long walk after dinner.

speaker: Faye
text: Yeah, it was great. [_heading out to the kitchen_] The streets were deserted, it was all misty out.  It was like we were the only two people in town. [_goes to the kitchen_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_flipping open his cell phone_] I wonder if Maris would rather have breakfast than lunch.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, put that down.

speaker: Martin
text: Now wait, Frasier, if Niles wants to leave-

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, please, there's no need for Niles to feel awkward. You're here.  It's not like he's some third wheel. living room in a short bathrobe and perches on the arm of Martin's recliner, putting her arm around him affectionately._

speaker: Bonnie
text: Good morning.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey!  You boys remember Bonnie, from McGinty's?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, of course.

speaker: Bonnie
text: I was at the Super Bowl party, remember?  I brought the ham loaf.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, who could forget?  We talked about it long after.

speaker: Niles
text: It came up almost daily.

speaker: Bonnie
text: Aren't you sweet? [_going into the kitchen_] I'm just going to get some coffee.

speaker: Martin
text: Okay. [_to Frasier, after Bonnie leaves_] You could have told me you were having Faye over.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sorry, Dad.  I didn't realize you were seeing Bonnie.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I see her from time to time.  You got a problem with Bonnie?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, no.

speaker: Martin
text: Because if you're bringing it up, you know, I have second thoughts about Faye.  I liked the other one you were seeing, Cassandra.  She was a dish!

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't care.  I prefer Faye.  I had to make a choice, no matter how much fun it was dating two beautiful women.

speaker: Niles
text: This morning just gets better and better.

speaker: Bonnie
text: [_coming in with Faye, each bearing a loaded tray_] Who wants coffee and pastry?

speaker: Niles
text: Nothing for me, thanks.

speaker: Faye
text: Are you sure?  I make a mean nutcake.

speaker: Niles
text: [_rising to get his coat_] No, that's all right, I'm meeting one for lunch.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, Bonnie, I see you've met Cassandra.

speaker: Faye
text: Who?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Lord, I'm sorry.  Faye!

speaker: Faye
text: Who's Cassandra?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, my... Aunt Cassandra.  Yes, that must be the-the connection.  See, you remind me a bit of her.  She was an angel, wasn't she, Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Cassandra?  Great gal.  I wish she was around.

speaker: Bonnie
text: Ah, Eddie, good morning.  I'll bet you can't wait to meet Lady.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, we're getting Eddie together with Bonnie's poodle. We figure if we hit it off, maybe something will happen for them.  Even dogs deserve happiness!

speaker: Niles
text: [_having had enough_] Okay, well, I'll be off.

speaker: Bonnie
text: [_pointing to Niles's blazer_] Oh, hold on, you've got a loose button right there.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, it's all right.

speaker: Bonnie
text: No, it's about to come off.

speaker: Niles
text: No-

speaker: Bonnie
text: [_pulling off the button_] See?  Here, I'll sew it back on for you. [_pulling the blazer off a reluctant Niles_] I've got needle and thread.  You don't want to lose it, do you?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm trying not to.  Frasier, I have to get out of here!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_guiding Niles to a chair_] Now Niles, listen, just relax. There's no cause for an anxiety attack.

speaker: Donny
text: Good morning!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_handing him the empty pastry bag_] Breathe into this! [_Niles waves it off_]

speaker: Martin
text: I didn't know you two were going to be here last night. Why doesn't somebody say something?

speaker: Donny
text: Well, we planned on going to my place, but we ended up going to a little piano bar just around the corner from here.

speaker: Daphne
text: Such a charming spot.  So intimate.  And to top it off, the piano player knew all my favorite songs - "Yesterday", "As Long As He Needs Me," "Climb Every Mountain."

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you threw him some real curves there.

speaker: Donny
text: [_to Faye_] Hi, I'm Donny Douglas, and I'm... in love.

speaker: Daphne
text: Listen to him.  He embarrasses me like that at least ten times a day.  And I just can't get enough of it. [_kisses Donny_] _Niles begins gasping again and heads over toward the couch, where Bonnie is still working on his blazer._

speaker: Niles
text: How we coming on the button?

speaker: Bonnie
text: I've almost got the needle threaded.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right!  You know, if anybody's hungry, we've got plenty of goodies here from Le Cigare Volante.  Cassandra's the pastry chef there.

speaker: Faye
text: She is?  I thought I was.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm so sorry!  God, I did it again.  I guess I must have her name on my mind.

speaker: Faye
text: Well, that's okay.  Just try to remember mine.

speaker: Faye
text: Faye!

speaker: Frasier
text: Faye!  Oh, Faye...

speaker: Donny
text: You know, I'm kind of glad this worked out the way it did. Neither Daphne nor I has any family here in Seattle.  You know what I'd like to do?  I'd like to make this our engagement breakfast.  _There are sentimental oohs and ahhs all around.  Niles's "ahh" looks suspiciously like a repressed scream._

speaker: Donny
text: Surrounded by friends who treat us like family.  And I'd like to dedicate it to the woman who's filled my life with a joy I never thought I'd find.  _Niles is really gasping now.  Everyone else clinks coffee cups and murmurs "hear, hear."_

speaker: Bonnie
text: Ah, Marty, I think I'm gonna cry.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, jeez...

speaker: Faye
text: [_admiring Daphne's hand_] Oh my God, look at that ring. _Daphne shows her ring to Bonnie and Faye as Niles faints, falling off his chair, unnoticed by anyone.  FADE OUT  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene One - The Radio Station -- A Few Days Later Frasier is signing off as Roz listens from the booth._

speaker: Frasier
text: That's it for today.  This is Dr. Frasier Crane saying goodbye, and good mental health.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nice job there, Roz.  Could you please try to find some callers that have real psychological problems?

speaker: Roz
text: Your dad's on Line 2.

speaker: Frasier
text: I meant during the show, thanks. [_picking up the phone_] Yeah, Dad, hi.  What, again?  Oh, that's the third time he's cancelled this week.  You know, he's been so lonely you'd think he'd be glad for my company.  Well, all right, no matter.  I guess I'll see you home in a while.  Oh, I don't know, later.  Oh, maybe an hour, two hours, I don't know!  Oh, for God's sake, well just hang a tie on the door if you're so worried about it! [_hanging up_]

speaker: Roz
text: Is everything okay, Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, Roz.  I was thinking about something.  You know, it's funny how loneliness can make people behave in strange ways.

speaker: Roz
text: [_looking guilty_] What do you mean?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you know, do things that are sort of rash, and act out of character.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh God, I knew someone would find out about it!  Who told you? Did he tell you?  I'll kill him!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: [_panicked_] Oh please, Frasier, don't tell anybody else! Oh, I beg you!  It was one night, one lonely, stupid night!

speaker: Frasier
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Roz
text: You don't know?

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  What happened?

speaker: Roz
text: [_covering, trying to leave_] Nothing, I'll see you tomorrow.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_stopping her_] Roz!  Stay right here.  Now you listen to me, I am your friend, you know that.  I would never judge you. Now, just how... stupid and lonely were you?

speaker: Roz
text: It's the last person I ever would have dreamed of. _Noel passes by and knocks on the glass, gazing fondly at Roz for a moment before moving on.  Roz waves to him distractedly and continues talking, but Frasier leaps to the obvious conclusion._

speaker: Roz
text: I guess I haven't been dating much lately and I just I've been so lonely.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God!  You've slept with Noel.

speaker: Roz
text: [_utterly disgusted_] _NO!_  Oh, how could you even think such a thing!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, just tell me.  Who was it?

speaker: Roz
text: Nobody.  It doesn't matter.  It's over.  It was a mistake and I just want to forget it ever happened.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, Roz, listen, we've all been there.  Come on.  You were just looking for a little comfort.  It's all right.  No reason to beat yourself up about it.  _Bulldog comes into the booth and greets Roz with genuine affection, trying to hug her._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, baby, I'm sorry I had to skip out before breakfast.

speaker: Roz
text: [_breaking away from him_] Oh, Bulldog!

speaker: Frasier
text: _Bulldog?!_

speaker: Roz
text: Bulldog.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_raising his fists in victory_] Bulldog!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, Frasier, swear you won't tell anybody else!

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_patting her on the rear_] So you told the doc, eh?  Guess you just had to brag, huh? [_as she hits him_] Hey, I don't blame you.  I told a few guys myself.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh God, oh God, oh God!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Gee, where have I heard that before?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_retreating hastily_] I'll just leave you two alone.

speaker: Roz
text: [_attempting to follow him_] I'm right behind you.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Gee, where have I heard that before? _He corners her, but she gets away from him and tries to go out the door.  He closes it and blocks her path.  He plays with the front of her sweater teasingly as she confronts him angrily._

speaker: Roz
text: Stop that!  Look, Bulldog, last night was a mistake.  I will regret it for the rest of my life, and if you ever bring it up again, I promise you you'll regret it.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey...  _He backs her up against the door and kisses her.  She hits him several times, each time more weakly.   They break the clinch, breathing heavily._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Your place tonight?

speaker: Roz
text: Ten o'clock.  Use the service elevator.  _Bulldog barks as Roz flees the studio.  FADE OUT  Scene Two - Frasier's Living Room - That Afternoon Daphne is cleaning the living room as Donny lounges on the couch, eating Chinese food from carryout cartons and dictating into a recorder.  Daphne is wearing a rubber glove on her left hand and is furtively looking around the floor for something.  Donny looks askance at her._

speaker: Daphne
text: How's the speech coming along?

speaker: Donny
text: Oh, it's almost finished. [_resuming his dictation_] "So though you are graduating today, your learning has just begun-" [_squirming on the couch_] There's something under the cushions back here.

speaker: Daphne
text: What, you found something?

speaker: Donny
text: [_reaching behind the cushion_] Oh, it's a cell phone.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_disappointed_] Oh.

speaker: Donny
text: [_handing it to her_] Is this Frasier's?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, he had his when he left for work this morning.  Must be his brother's.  I'll tell him the next time he's over. [_leaving_] I'm... going to finish tidying up the kitchen.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, all.

speaker: Donny
text: Hey, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_eyeing Donny's gym shoes and cartons on the suede couch_] Hello, Donny.  I hope I didn't come home at an inconvenient moment.

speaker: Donny
text: No, your timing's perfect, actually.  One eggroll left.

speaker: Donny
text: Nice hands.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, they were.  _Daphne comes in and continues looking around the living room furtively as she hands Donny a glass._

speaker: Daphne
text: Here's your drink.

speaker: Donny
text: Oh, thanks. [_to Frasier_] Isn't she great?  Takes me on a three mile run and then feeds me diet soda. [_eating another eggroll_] I thought I'd hate healthy living, but you know, it ain't so bad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, why are you wearing that rubber glove?

speaker: Daphne
text: What, this?  I was, um... doing the dishes.

speaker: Frasier
text: With just one?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_inventing_] It's the English way.  You wash with the left, dry with the right.  Started during the war, I think, when rubber was rationed.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes.

speaker: Daphne
text: Can I see you in the kitchen, Dr. Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, of course.  Let me just call Niles first.  He cancelled on me again today.

speaker: Donny
text: Oh, I'll just be a second here.  I just have to check up on a case I'm finishing.  Poor bastard, I'm really taking him to the cleaners.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, perhaps you'd be so kind as to bring the couch along. _Reset to: Kitchen Frasier follows Daphne into the kitchen._

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Daphne?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm afraid a terrible thing has happened.  I've lost my engagement ring.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, where was the last place you saw it?

speaker: Daphne
text: That's just it, I've searched everywhere!  I'm terrified Donny'll find out.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, you can't go around hiding your hand forever. You're gonna have to tell him.  He's a reasonable man, he'll understand.

speaker: Daphne
text: I suppose you're right.  _She pulls off her rubber glove, but Donny comes into the kitchen on the cordless phone and she dives toward the refrigerator._

speaker: Donny
text: [_on the phone_] You're negligent, pal!  You're criminally irresponsible, you were careless, and you're going to pay for it!  Yeah! [_hanging up and tossing the cordless phone to Frasier_] Here you go, boss.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Donny
text: Hey, Daph?  _Daphne emerges from the refrigerator with her left hand inside a raw chicken._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_nonchalantly_] Yes, love?

speaker: Donny
text: What are you doing?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I'm just stuffing the bird for Dr. Crane's dinner.

speaker: Donny
text: Oh.  Listen, unfortunately I'm going to have to work late. I'm going to just pop in the shower and then I'll have to leave.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_seasoning the bird_] Oh, I'm sorry.

speaker: Donny
text: Oh, that's okay.  Absence just makes the heart grow fonder.  _He pulls her into a kiss and she hugs him, her hand still inside the chicken.  He heads off toward Daphne's room as Frasier speed-dials the phone._

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Daphne, if that ring never turns up, that chicken works, too.  Just see how it catches the light.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, stop it!  I'm just going to go have a look in the bedroom.  _She extracts her hand and leaves.  Frasier talks on the phone as he replaces the chicken in the refrigerator and washes his hand._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?  Niles? [_leaving a message_] It's Frasier.  Yes, listen, I've tried you at your office, I've tried you at home, now I'm calling your cell phone.  If I don't reach you now I'm actually going to get very worried about you.  _He stays on the phone in the kitchen as Martin comes in the front door and hears Niles's cell phone ringing on top of the bookcase. He hobbles over to answer it._

speaker: Martin
text: Hello?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, hello, is Niles Crane there, please?

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, I don't know, I just got here.  Let me go check.  _He puts the cell phone down and looks around, then goes into the kitchen, where Frasier is still on the portable phone._

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier, have you seen Niles?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm just trying to reach him, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, okay.

speaker: Martin
text: No, I'm sorry, he's not here, but I'll write your name down and give it to him.  Wait a minute, I've gotta find a pen.

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier, have you seen my-

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, please, I'm on the phone!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm sorry, I was just looking for a pen!  Forget it.  _He goes back to the living room as Frasier realizes what's going on. He follows Martin._

speaker: Martin
text: [_on the phone_] Hello?  Listen, could you maybe call back in an hour?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Would you mind, please?  I'm on the phone!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_into his phone_] Dad, it's me.

speaker: Martin
text: [_realizing_] Frasier, why did you call from the kitchen? You could have just walked in here!

speaker: Frasier
text: Just hang up the phone. [_Martin does_] For God's sake, it must be Niles's cell phone.  Gee, that's strange. He's never without that phone.

speaker: Martin
text: Huh.

speaker: Frasier
text: And what's more, he's been avoiding me for the last three days.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, cut him a little slack.  Seeing the six of us the other morning couldn't have done much for his mood.  He's probably just gone off somewhere to be by himself.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I just hope he hasn't done something foolish.  Remember he was having brunch with Maris on Sunday.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that was just business.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, Dad, he is broken-hearted.  People in his condition have a tendency to run back to their exes.  A lonely man clinging to an available warm body.  Well, of course in Maris's case, that's just an expression.

speaker: Martin
text: He just spent two years divorcing her.  He's not going to go back to her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, I hope you're right.  Say, didn't you have plans today with Bonnie?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, it was cut short.  We had an incident.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  What happened?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, we took the dogs to this park near Bonnie's, and I knew there'd be a little sizing each other up and everything. But this poodle of hers, Lady - which she ain't! - walks right up to Eddie, knocks him over and then sits her big French butt right on his head.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're kidding.

speaker: Martin
text: No.  And the worst thing was, he just lay there whimpering and took it.  And Bonnie, she thought it was really cute. I mean, what kind of a person likes to see a dog humiliated?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, may I remind you that not a holiday goes by that you don't dress that dog up in some sort of ridiculous hat?

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, there's nothing wrong with those hats.  He looks good in hats.  He's got a hat face!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, he was probably just intimidated being over in Lady's park, you know.  Wait'll he gets over to this side of town. He owns that park.  Even the big dogs are scared of him.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's because they've seen him in his hats and they think he's crazy!

speaker: Frasier
text: It's Niles's cell phone. [_answering_] Hello?  Niles Crane's... phone.  Yes, it's his brother.  I'll be glad to tell him. Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well.  That was St. Pierre jewelers.  The diamond earrings Niles ordered are ready.

speaker: Martin
text: Diamond earrings?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh-huh.  From Maris's favorite jeweler.  You know what, he's obviously too afraid to tell us that he's run back to her.

speaker: Martin
text: Now stop that, you're scaring me.  He doesn't have to be with Maris.  Maybe he's hurt, maybe he's in the hospital or something.  _Frasier puts on his trench coat and hands Martin his jacket.  Martin doesn't budge out of his chair._

speaker: Frasier
text: We've got to track him down and talk some sense into him. I'll tell you what, we'll head over to the Montana, and if he's not there, we'll go to Maris's.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I don't want to go to Niles's and I sure as hell don't want to go to Maris's!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, this is not about what you or I want, this is about what Niles needs!  For God's sakes, the man is devastated, he's vulnerable.  We need to rally around him and show him our support.

speaker: Martin
text: [_giving up and following Frasier out the door_] Well, why didn't we just do this on Sunday?

speaker: Frasier
text: We had our girlfriends over! _FADE OUT  Scene Three - The Montana - Hallway Outside Niles's Apartment Frasier rings the bell as Martin hangs back._

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, what are you doing back there?  What are you so worried about?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, what do you think?  Running into Maris.  You know how angry she gets.  I just wish we had a sharp stick or a heavy net or something.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, where have you been?  You haven't been answering any of my calls.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Frasier, I am so sorry.  I'll call you tomorrow.

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  I want to talk to you right now.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I can't.  I'm, I'm... [_meaningfully_] _entertaining_ , so off you go.

speaker: Martin
text: [_vehemently, pushing his way inside_] No, we're not leaving without you, so put on your shower shoes and a coat and let's get out of here.

speaker: Niles
text: What is wrong with you?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_following Martin in_] Niles, I know how difficult the last three weeks have been for you.  I'm sorry, you are making a big mistake.  This is NOT the way to handle it.

speaker: Niles
text: So - you know what's going on?

speaker: Martin
text: Yes, Niles!

speaker: Frasier
text: How did this whole thing even get started?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, we had an impromptu coffee at the Cafe Nervosa, and that led to a movie, and that led to dinner, and ever since then we've been practically inseparable [_smiling_] and to tell you the truth, we're kind of happy about it. [_Frasier and Martin look disgusted_] How do you even know about this?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_handing him his cell phone_] Your jeweler called.  Your diamond earrings are ready.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, well, thank you for the message.  Now go away!

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  Niles, we're not going anywhere.  You may consider this a full-blown intervention.  We're not leaving until you have got some self-respect back! _Kit comes dashing down to the upstairs landing in a fit of enthusiasm and a fetching red silk pajama top, clearly one of Niles's.  She looks like Meg Ryan with long curly hair._

speaker: Kit
text: Niles!  You know what we should do tonight? [_seeing Frasier and Martin_] Oh, hi. [_going right on_] Build a fire and make s'mores.

speaker: Frasier
text: You might also want to get some graham crackers.

speaker: Kit
text: [_coming down to the living room and putting her arms around Niles_] I'm sorry, I didn't know we had company.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, that's okay.  Kit, this is-

speaker: Kit
text: [_pointing at Frasier_] No, wait, I know you from the cafe. Cappuccino, light foam. [_to Martin_] And you too.  Coffee, black, nothin' fancy!

speaker: Niles
text: [_hugging her in delight_] Isn't that good?  Kit, this is my father, Martin, and my brother, um... [_thinking_] Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: How do you do?

speaker: Kit
text: Really? [_looking at Niles_] Oh, I see it.  Cool!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, this is sort of a surprise, I guess.  We didn't expect to see the two of you together.

speaker: Kit
text: [_with her arms around Niles_] Oh, I had my eye him from the minute I saw him.  He's always so neatly put together.  I just couldn't wait to mess him up!  _She musses his robe playfully.  Niles is a little startled but flattered. He's digging this in a big way._

speaker: Niles
text: And mission accomplished!

speaker: Frasier
text: So, Niles, you haven't seen Maris then since Sunday?

speaker: Niles
text: [_catching on and grinning smugly_] Oh, is that who you thought I was here with?  That's funny.  No wonder you were upset.

speaker: Kit
text: Who's Maris?

speaker: Niles
text: My ex-wife.

speaker: Kit
text: Well, if you want to see her too, that's cool.  I told you, no strings. [_rubbing his face seductively_] Just fun.
